history.content:
In my opinion, no, simply because it is not worth the risk (missing out on CS); once you get into CS, feel free (and do) to test your limits (it makes me sick to write this, but it is what it is). And 61b will take up a large portion of your time once you get past the initial intro to java stage (it is at least 2-3x the workload of 61a). Try maybe joining an easy cog sci class or just take some decal(s) (a lot are still open), and work on getting a good grade in 61b so you get some margin for 70 later.

--------

Different opinion here! I think this is absolutely doable. There certainly is some risk if your time management is poor but if you are confident, go for 70. It's not too bad. I would also consider enroll safely in another easy class to make sure you are above the min unit limit. You can later drop that class if you successfully get into 70.

--------

Hey also a freshman here who took 61B & 70 last semester with 2 breadth classes (so I too fall into the range of the 3.3GPA). I'm by no means good at programming/math, but it was definitely doable. A few weeks can get really tough--mostly project weeks--but for the majority it's around 15-25 hours/week combined out of class total for the two classes. Though if you're going to take CS70, I'd sign up as soon as possible because the pace only picks up from here.

--------

And a fourth conglomerate opinion: some people can handle both no problem, others might struggle (not saying one is better! people are just different). Ask yourself how confident you are that you're in the former group as opposed to the latter, knowing that being wrong could make it very difficult to declare CS.

--------

Just to add another voice, ask yourself, "how confident do I feel with those kinds of random math questions that aren't really based on 'textbook math' like calculus or algebra?" CS 70 is a class that rewards intellectual flexibility, since being able to grasp the concepts well is the most important.  If you're comfortable with those kinds of problems, CS 70 should be ok. If not, all bets are off.

I'm a freshman intended CS and Cog Sci double major. I'm taking History 100AC, Psych 1, and CS 61B right now (11 total units). I got dropped from my MCB C61 class, so I'm under the minimum unit limit now and most classes are full. Should I take CS 70 with 61B? I'm 46th on the waitlist for CS 70 right now and Rao said there's a good chance I'll get in. Psych and History seem fairly easy, but I don't know if those 2 CS classes together would be overkill. In case it helps, I got a B+ in CS 61A last semester but was only like 2 points from an A-.
history.subject: CS 70 and CS 61B together?
